column4: i did chmod -R 600 <myhomefolder> and now i cant log in! plz help!
that was a bad, bad idea
you're probably going to have to boot into single user mode to fix it
at your grub prompt press 'e' then type 'init=/bin/bash' and hit enter.  that should get you to a root prompt.
once i am root, what then? how to fix what ive messed up?
once you've done that you should be able to log in normally, but a lot of stuff is still going to be broken.  let's see what we can fix...
that should fix 98% of what you broke.  now reboot normally and think REALLY REALLY hard before using chmod -R in the future.
what I said to transgress was meant for you
thanks:).......actually i was trying to make my home folder inaccessible to another user (my bro:)......
yeah I've made a similar mistake.  just chmod 750 (NO -R) and make sure he's not in the same group as you
i had noticed that my desktop icons became all red! when i made that mistake.......
